Headline: England World Cup Watch
Description: Gareth Southgate names his England squad on Wednesday, but did anyone stake a late claim on the final day of the Premier League season?

Headline: Puel: Vardy can play alongside Kane
Description: Leicester manager Claude Puel has backed Jamie Vardy and Harry Kane to forge a World Cup strike force for England.

Headline: Neymar 'fears' return from injury
Description: Neymar has admitted he needs to overcome the "fear" of his broken foot injury to inspire Brazil at this summer’s World Cup.

Headline: Alves ruled out of World Cup
Description: Brazil defender Dani Alves has been ruled out of the upcoming World Cup in Russia, the Brazilian Football Confederation have confirmed.

Headline: Southgate to name squad next week
Description: Gareth Southgate will announce England's final World Cup squad on May 16, the Football Association has confirmed.

Headline: 'Alexander-Arnold ready for World Cup'
Description: Jurgen Klopp believes Gareth Southgate would be making a "good choice" if he includes Trent Alexander-Arnold in England's World Cup squad.

Headline: Alves in World Cup injury scare
Description: Brazil's Dani Alves will be out for at least three weeks after injuring his anterior cruciate ligament, PSG have confirmed.

Headline: Neuer expected to miss World Cup
Description: Manuel Neuer's participation at the World Cup is in major doubt after Jupp Heynckes said he is unlikely to play again this season.

Headline: Russia fined for discriminatory chanting
Description: FIFA has fined the Russian soccer federation £22,000 for discriminatory chanting by fans.

Headline: 'Portugal can't win WC without Ronaldo'
Description: Jose Mourinho says Portugal winning this summer's World Cup would be "impossible" if they did not have Cristiano Ronaldo.

Headline: Gomez out of World Cup after op
Description: Liverpool defender Joe Gomez will miss the World Cup after undergoing season-ending ankle surgery.

Headline: Ozil: I'll be fit for World Cup
Description: Mesut Ozil is confident he'll have recovered from a back injury in time to represent Germany at the World Cup.

Headline: England World Cup Watch
Description: How did England's World Cup hopefuls fare over the penultimate weekend of the Premier League season?

Headline: France confirm Koscielny out of WC
Description: France defender Laurent Koscielny will miss the World Cup due to injury.

Headline: FIFA proposes 'mini-World Cup'
Description: FIFA president Gianni Infantino has proposed staging a new tournament, featuring eight international teams, every two years.

Headline: 'Utd must aim for bigger, better things'
Description: David de Gea opens up to Sky Sports about awards, improving as a player and his dreams of silverware for club and country.

Headline: Cahill in provisional Australia squad
Description: Tim Cahill has been included in Australia's provisional squad for the World Cup in Russia.

Headline: Poch: Kane ready for World Cup
Description: Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino says Harry Kane will be 100 per cent ready both physically and mentally for England's World Cup campaign.

Headline: 'Milner should make England U-turn'
Description: In-form Liverpool midfielder James Milner could play a key role for England at the World Cup if he was to end his international retirement, says Jamie Redknapp.

Headline: Germany's Stindl out of World Cup
Description: Germany and Borussia Monchengladbach forward Lars Stindl has been ruled out of the World Cup through injury.

Headline: 'England one of World Cup favourites'
Description: England are fifth favourites to win the World Cup, according to research group CIES Football Observatory.

Headline: European Leagues oppose FIFA plans
Description: Plans by FIFA to introduce a revamped FIFA Club World Cup and a new FIFA Nations League have been met by opposition.

Headline: Security assurances for England WAGs
Description: England players have been reassured that family members travelling to the World Cup in Russia will be provided with security experts.

Headline: United wait on Lukaku injury
Description: Jose Mourinho is unsure whether Romelu Lukaku will be fit for the FA Cup final after limping out of Man Utd's 2-1 win over Arsenal.

Headline: Trump issues World Cup threat
Description: Donald Trump has warned nations opposing the North American bid for the 2026 World Cup they risk losing the United States' political support.

Headline: Zlatan opts against World Cup return
Description: Zlatan Ibrahimovic will not play at this year's World Cup, the Swedish FA has announced.

Description: With less than a month to go until Gareth Southgate names his squad for the World Cup in Russia, we look at how his England hopefuls got on this weekend.

Headline: Hodgson backs FA over Wembley
Description: Former England boss Roy Hodgson says any potential sale of Wembley by the FA would be "for the right reasons".

Description: Egypt are hopeful Arsenal midfielder Mohamed Elneny will be available for the World Cup despite him sustaining ankle ligament damage.

Headline: World Cup ticket sales slow in Europe
